solution_line_template: She uses ${ingredient_cost_per_bag} of ingredients per 1 bag of granola and she makes {total_bags} bags so she spends {ingredient_cost_per_bag}*{total_bags} = $<<{ingredient_cost_per_bag}*{total_bags}={total_ingredient_cost}>>{total_ingredient_cost} on ingredients
She sells {full_price_bags} bags for ${full_price} so she makes {full_price_bags}*{full_price} = $<<{full_price_bags}*{full_price}={full_price_revenue}>>{full_price_revenue}
She sells her last {discount_bags} bags for ${discount_price} so she makes {discount_bags}*{discount_price} = $<<{discount_bags}*{discount_price}={discount_revenue}>>{discount_revenue}
She made ${full_price_revenue} and ${discount_revenue} for a total of {full_price_revenue}+{discount_revenue} = $<<{full_price_revenue}+{discount_revenue}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}

She made ${total_revenue} but spent ${total_ingredient_cost} on ingredients so her net profit is {total_revenue}-{total_ingredient_cost} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_ingredient_cost}={net_profit}>>{net_profit}
